page.title: 03ALFRICK SCHOOL.
page.content: Alfrick Primary School was opened,as a Board School,on the 18th.Sept.1876. It is a typical Victorian school building. Built of red brick with stone window frames and a steeply pitched slate roof.The classrooms were large with painted brick walls, wooden floors and very high ceilings. Over the years the numbers changed. When it first opened there were 26 children on roll,three weeks later there were 91. In the early 20's there were 80 children with 3 teachers.In the early 50's there were 50 children still with 3 teachers.By 1983 the number had dropped to 18 children with one teacher and it was decided to close the school.The children were transferred to Suckley School at the beginning of Sept.1983. The closure was an unpopular move as the school had been held in high regard.
